intro: Onosma zangezura, commonly known as Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Onosma zangezura is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
